Facility ID: Whether the facility maximum water lead value was above 1 ppb
Whether the facility maximum water lead value was above 5 ppb
Whether the facility maximum water lead value was above 10 ppb
Whether the facility maximum water lead value was above 15 ppb
Whether the facility 90th percentile water lead values was above 1 ppb
Whether the facility 90th percentile water lead values was above 5 ppb
Whether the facility 90th percentile water lead values was above 10 ppb
Whether the facility 90th percentile water lead values was above 15 ppb
Percent of enrolled children receiving free/reduced lunch
Percent of enrolled children identifying as non-White
Total number of children enrolled
The number of drinking and cooking water samples collected for analysis by the center (center staff were instructed to sample all drinking and cooking taps).
The percentage of taps sampled by each center that had a point-of-use filter installed and was flagged as filtered by center staff.
The percent of the population in the Census block group where the facility is located that identifies as a race other than White alone
The percent of the population in the Census block group where the facility is located that has attained a high school degree or higher
The median household income of the Census block group where the facility is located
Whether the center building was owned or leased.
Whether the center was a federally funded Head Start program
Whether the center was located in a school building
Whether the center was located in a home
Whether the center was part of a franchise
Year the building was constructed
Whether the center was located in an area designated as a HUD Opportunity Zone
Whether the center was connected to a public community water system (CWS)

Whether the center used a private well for its water supply. This was determined according to whether the center responded “No” to the question “Does your drinking water come from a public water treatment plant?” and “Yes” to the question “Does the center use well water?” This variable was not mutually exclusive with “Community water system” suggesting that a) some non-CWS systems receive water from a source other than a well, b) that center staff were not aware that they were served by a CWS, or c) the center staff were not aware that they received water from a private well.
Whether the center was served by an onsite wastewater system
Whether the center had any known past faucet fixture changes
Year of past faucet fixture change
Year the licensed center began operating
Whether the the water utility that the facility is served by had any Lead and Copper Rule action level exceedance in the five years prior to sampling (2016-2020)
Water system source water type. Centers reporting using private well water default to groundwater. Other centers not served by a community water system coded as missing.
Whether the water system implements pH adjustment. Centers reporting using private well water default to no pH adjustment.  Other centers not served by a community water system coded as missing.

Whether the water system implements phosphate-based corrosion control. Centers reporting using private well water default to no phosphate addition.  Other centers not served by a community water system coded as missing.

Whether the water system uses chloramination for disinfection. Centers reporting using private well water default to no chloramination.  Other centers not served by a community water system coded as missing.

Whether the water system implements coagulation in the treatment train. Centers reporting using private well water default to no coagulation.  Other centers not served by a community water system coded as missing.
The number of service connections of the water system the facility is served by, categorized according to EPA designations for small, medium, and large
Rural-Urban Community Area (RUCA) classification
